channel.title: D-BAS Feed
channel.description: Latest news about D-BAS, a Dialog-Based Argumentation System

item.title: some new title
item.description: some new text
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Finding from our fieldtest
item.description: In the meantime we have finished the evaluation of our first fieldtest, which was done carried out to our complete satisfaction. At the moment we are working on our new paper, which will be finished soon. Stay tuned!
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: HCI in Canada
item.description: Last week we had the chance to introduce our work about embedding dialog-based discussion into the real world at the HCI in Vancouver. It was a very huge and broad conference with many interesting talks and workshops. Thanks to all listeners during Christians talk.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: First fieldtest
item.description: Today we have started our first, real fieldtest, where we invited every student of computer science to talk about improvements of our study programme. Our number of students drastic increased during the last years, therefore we have to manage some problems like a shortage of space for working places and a lack of place classrooms. Our fieldtest will be supported by sociology students, who will also do an survey based on our metrics we invented mid 2015.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Docker
item.description: Last weeks we have spend to make D-BAS more stable, writing some analyzers as well as dockerize everything. The complete project can be found on https://github.com/hhucn/dbas soon.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Great Test
item.description: Finally we have a version of D-BAS which can be used during a large fieldtest at our university. Nevertheless the same version is capable to be viewed by some reviewers of our latest paper. Stay tuned!
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Experiment
item.description: Last week we finished our second experiment at our professorial chair. In short we are very happy with the results and with the first, bigger argumentation map created by inexperienced participants! Now we will fix a few smaller things and looking forward to out first field test!
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Final version and Captachs
item.description: Today we submitted a journal paper about D-BAS and its implementation at Springers CSCW.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Final version and Captachs
item.description: We have a delayed christmas present for you. D-BAS reached it's first final version including reCAPTCHAS and several minor fixes!
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Work goes on
item.description: After the positive feedback at COMMA16, we decided to do a first field tests with D-BAS at our university. Therefore we are working on current issues, so that we will releasing v1.0. soon.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: COMMA16
item.description: Based on the hard work of the last month, we are attending the 6th International Conference on Computational Models of Argument (COMMA16) in Potsdam. There we are going to show the first demo of D-BAS and present the paper of Krauthoff T., Betz G., Baurmann M. & Mauve, M. (2016) "Dialog-Based Online Argumentation". Looking forward to see you!
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Review Process
item.description: Our first version of the review-module is now online. Every confronting argument can be flagged regarding a specific reason now. Theses flagged argument will be reviewed by other participants, who have enough reputation. Have a look at the review-section!
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Review Process
item.description: I regret that i have neglected the news section, but this is in your interest. In the meantime we are working on an graph view for our argumentation model, a review section for statements and we are improving the ways how we act with each kind of user input. Stay tuned!
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Sidebar
item.description: Today we released a new text-based sidebar for a better experience. Have fun!
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: COMMA16
item.description: We are happy to announce, that our paper for the COMMA16 was accepted. In the meantime many little improvements as well as first user tests were done.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: History Management
item.description: We have changed D-BAS' history management. Now you can bookmark any link in any discussion and your history will always be with you!
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Development is going on
item.description: Recently we improved some features, which will be released in future. Firstly there will be an island view for every argument, where the participants can see every premise for current reactions. Secondly the opinion barometer is still under development. For a more recent update, have a look at our imprint.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: COMMA16
item.description: After much work, testing and debugging, we now have version of D-BAS, which will be submitted to COMMA 2016.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Speech Bubble System
item.description: After one week of testing, we released a new minor version of D-BAS. Instead of the text presentation,we will use chat-like style :) Come on and try it! Additionally anonymous users will have a history now!
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Notification System
item.description: Yesterday we have develope a minimal notification system. This system could send information to every author, if one of their statement was edited. More features are coming soon!
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Premisegroups
item.description: Now we have a mechanism for unclear statements. For example the user enters "I want something because A and B". The we do not know, whether A and B must hold at the same time, or if she wants something when A or B holds. Therefore the system requests feedback.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: API
item.description: Now D-BAS has an API. Just replace the "discuss"-tag in your url with api to get your current steps raw data.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Refactoring
item.description: D-BAS refactored the last two weeks. During this time, a lot of JavaScript was removed. Therefore D-BAS uses Chameleon with TAL in the Pyramid-Framework. So D-BAS will be more stable and faster. The next period all functions will be tested and recovered.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Island View and Pictures
item.description: D-BAS will be more personal and results driven. Therefore the new release has profile pictures for everyone. They are powered by gravatar and are based on a md5-hash of the users email. Next to this a new view was published - the island view. Do not be shy and try it in discussions ;-) Last improvement just collects the attacks and supports for arguments...this is needed for our next big thing :) Stay tuned!
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Voting Model
item.description: Currently we are improving out model of voting for arguments as well as statements. Therefore we are working together with our colleagues from the theoretical computer science... because D-BAS data structure can be formalized to be compatible with frameworks of Dung.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Happy new Year
item.description: Frohes Neues Jahr ... Bonne Annee ... Happy New Year ... Feliz Ano Nuevo ... Feliz Ano Novo
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Piwik
item.description: Today Piwik was installed. It will help to improve the services of D-BAS!
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Logic improvements
item.description: Every week we try to improve the look and feel of the discussions navigation. Sometimes just a few words are edited, but on other day the logic itself gets an update. So keep on testing :)
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Breadcrumbs
item.description: Now we have a breadcrumbs with shortcuts for every step in our discussion. This feature will be im improved soon!
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Improved Bootstrapping
item.description: Bootstraping is one of the main challenges in discussion. Therefore we have a two-step process for this task!
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Design Update
item.description: Today we released a new material-oriented design. Enjoy it!
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Stable release
item.description: After two weeks of debugging, a first and stable version is online. Now we can start with the interesting things!
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Different topics
item.description: Since today we can switch between different topics :) Unfortunately this feature is not really tested ;-)
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: New logic for inserting
item.description: Logic for inserting statements was redone. Every time, where the user can add information via a text area, only the area is visible, which is logically correct. Therefore the decisions are based on argumentation theory.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Anonymous users after vacation
item.description: After two and a half week of vacation we have a new feature. The discussion is now available for anonymous users, therefore everyone can participate, but only registered users can make and edit statements.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Vacation done
item.description: After two and a half weeks of vacation a new feature was done. Hence anonymous users can participate, the discussion is open for all, but committing and editing statements is for registered users only.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: New URL-Schemes
item.description: Now D-BAS has unique urls for the discussion, therefore these urls can be shared.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Long time, no see!
item.description: In the mean time we have developed a new, better, more logically data structure. Additionally the navigation was refreshed.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: i18n/l10n
item.description: Internationalization is now working :)
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: i18n
item.description: Still working on i18n-problems of chameleon templates due to lingua. If this is fixed, i18n of jQuery will happen. Afterwards l10n will take place.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Design & Research
item.description: D-BAS is still under construction. Meanwhile the index page was recreated and we are improving our algorithm for the guided view mode. Next to this we are inventing a bunch of metrics for measuring the quality of discussion in several software programs.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Session Management / CSRF
item.description: D-BAS is no able to manage a session as well as it has protection against CSRF.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Edit/Changelog
item.description: Now, each user can edit positions and arguments. All changes will be saved and can be watched. Future work is the chance to edit the relations between positions.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Simple Navigation was improved
item.description:
Because the first kind of navigation was finished recently, D-BAS is now dynamically. That means, that each user can add positions and arguments on his own.
Open issues are i18n, a framework for JS-tests as well as the content of the popups.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Simple Navigation ready
item.description: First beta of D-BAS navigation is now ready. Within this kind the user will be permanently confronted with arguments, which have a attack relation to the current selected argument/position. For an justification the user can select out of all arguments, which have a attack relation to the 'attacking' argument. Unfortunately the support-relation are currently useless except for the justification for the position at start.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Admin Interface
item.description: Everything is growing, we have now a little admin interface and a navigation for the discussion is finished, but this is very basic and simple
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Sharing
item.description: Every news can now be shared via FB, G+, Twitter and Mail. Not very important, but in some kind it is...
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Workshop
item.description: Today: A new workshop at the O.A.S.E. :)
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Tests and JS
item.description: Front-end tests with Splinter are now finished. They are great and easy to manage. Additionally I'am working on JS, so we can navigate in a static graph. Next to this, the I18N is waiting...
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: JS Starts
item.description: Today started the funny part about the dialog based part, embedded in the content page.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: No I18N + L10N
item.description: Interationalization and localization is much more difficult than described by pyramid. This has something todo with Chameleon 2, Lingua and Babel, so this feature has to wait.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: I18N + L10N
item.description: D-BAS, now with internationalization and translation.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Settings
item.description: New part of the website is finished: a settings page for every user.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: About the Workshop in Karlsruhe
item.description: The workshop was very interesting. We have had very interesting talks and got much great feedback vom Jun.-Prof. Dr. Betz and Mr. Voigt. A repetition will be planed for the middle of july.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Workshop in Karlsruhe
item.description: The working group 'functionality' will drive to Karlsruhe for a workshop with Jun.-Prof. Dr. Betz as well as with C. Voigt until 08.05.2015. Our main topics will be the measurement of quality of discussions and the design of online-participation. I think, this will be very interesting!
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: First set of tests
item.description: Finished first set of unit- and integration tests for the database and frontend.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Page is growing
item.description: The contact page is now working as well as the password-request option.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: System will be build up
item.description:
Currently I am working a lot at the system. This work includes:
  • frontend-design with CSS and jQuery
  • backend-development with pything
  • development of unit- and integration tests
  • a database scheme
  • validating and deserializing data with Colander
  • translating string with internationalization
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: First mockup
item.description: The webpage has now a contact, login and register site.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: Start
item.description: I've started with the Prototype.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff

item.title: First steps
item.description: I've started with with my PhD.
item.author: Tobias Krauthoff
